rComments: really awesome!
Still the best.

The class really helped me with SPSS and learning how to do good research. There was a LOT of work involved throughout the whole term but Dr. Amitay was always sending lots of Emails to help out each step. And he told us exactly what to prepare for on the exam. Excellent experience overall.
Three words to describe Dr. Amitay, "SIMPLY THE BEST".
He was inspiring! Funny, very knowledgable, and master of critical thinking!

An excellent seminar course. Prepared me for grad school and got me thinking critically! Based on mostly recent relevant articles but we got some great insight into the studies and the authors. He came across as an arrogant know it all in class but was genuinely kind in person and helped me out a couple of years after the class.
Did a satisfactory job, but there was/is room for improvement.

Took this course 2 years ago and his classes are very interesting. He does go off the textbook quite a bit and one portion of his exams are straight from lectures! Exams were fairly hard but he bell-curved when we did poorly. Great prof!
I had him 1st yr, and currenly am in 3rd. No other prof thus far in psych has outdone him.
Had a forward personality which is ironic given the content of the course. Did an alright job.  I'd probably take the course again.

Agreed with last rater and wtf to the 2 before! I've seen many of Dr Amitay's media appearances too, and he clearly knows a LOT about psychology like he proved in class. Exams were hard but I showed up, took good notes, and got an A+. Still #1 in my books, even if UTSC was stupid enough to let him go.

Last 2 raters don't seem to get that you don't have to be a boring stuffy prof to be good.I see Prof A all over TV, always free-stylin' about anything.He does the same in class too.That's true genius IMO.If last 2 raters came to office hours they'd know why he teaches all over.They'd also know he works insane hours.Over all, best prof.

In all fairness, I wasn't seriously impressed.  There are better psychology teachers at this campus.  I found his approach to be "campy" in style.  Like the previous rater, despite his enthusiasm, I found him difficult to take seriously.  I'm also curious as to why he appears to be jumping from school to school (just saying).
ok Instructor... I found him to be a bit over the edge and too informal for a university level course (although his intentions appeared to be good).  The content of the course was interesting.

So much of what Prof. Amitay warned us about bad research came true when I entered 4th year, then grad school. I know he kept having to remind us he doesn't hate social pysch or research, only BAD research. Thank g-d he taught us to discriminate good from bad research. No other prof has done that so far, they just pretend it's ALL good research.
Brilliant professor! It's a shame UTSC let him go, would've loved to have him for the upper-level personality related courses.
amazing prof!!!!

Not only did Oren make most profs look terrible b/c he was so good, but he even got back to me after I graduated and helped me out with questions I had about clinical psych. His love and knowledge of psychology is unparallelled. I can't believe UTSC let him go. Look who's left! Only a few other profs come close!

My absolute favourite prof !!! Learned so much from him, most importantly stuff outside class material and how to "THINK CRITICALLY"...his classes are so enjoyable and it really makes me love to learn !!! I would advise anyone who loves psych to take his class, he really is born to teach and wonderful at what he does !
Hey,I JUST heard that the best prof ever isn't coming back! The exams were day-amn! hard, but prof Oren told us everything we needed to know. You'll be missed SIR!
He is intelligent, humorous, organized, helpful... This is a man who is born to teach. Every time I go to his class, I come out with much more than I expected. It's a privilege to take his class.
He'll teach you about psychology, but he'll also teach you to make yourself a better person in this world we live in.  He is one of those unique professors who you will remember for life.
Awesome professor. Attendance at lectures is a must as he gives hints at exam questions. Very entertaining, although he does tend to sidetrack a bit.

I took the online course as well, he is one of the best profs I've had. He's to psychology what Professor Leonard is to literature. Not only do you learn A LOT but you get inspired a very rare and amazing combination. I hope he teaches more courses at UTSC, i'm not a psychology major or minor but if he is teaching a course I will take it.

i took this course on-line adn even then it was amazing. i just wish i could of seen prof amitay's lectuures in person :( :( but the exams a killer, but i think the final was much easier, and he gives lots of hints about the exam
AMAZING! love this guy he is so funny and he actually makes you want to come to class... his exams are kind of hard but he tells you what is on them
Great balance of SPSS, research design, the "secrets behind psychology" and everything else that maeks up an amazing learning experience!

Very clear and concise in his explanations  and expectations. To do well, you must go to lectures and study both them and the textbook. Yes, the midterm average was low, but a number of people underestimated the weight of his lectures - their mistake. He specified that lectures ARE important. Great prof. Engaging. Knowledgeable.Got a 90.

He was a good professor. Made it very clear what we should and should not study for the midterm and final. His lectures were really intersting and he seems to know his material really well. One word of advice, you can't miss lectures and expect to do well.

uhhh. I don't know what the people are saying.  "WOW AMAZING PROF".  THe fact is, class average for midterm was 50%.  He bell curved 10%.  A whole chunk of people dropped, pushing up the class average.  Me, who thought the class avg was still low, got screwed over when he didn't bell curve after the final.

Everyone who rates are probably very enthusiastic about psychology.  Thinks he's very inspiring.  My experience is that you have to read both textbook and lectures and have no guarantee on how well you do.  Takes intro to Psychology and makes the difficulty like a C level course.  NOT recommended for those that don't wish to screw up their CGPA!
He is everything! He is critical fun, passionate, interesting, professional... and all any other GOODS that I can think of!

Great professor! I'm majoring in psychology thanks to him, he makes the class so fun and yet he gives out a lot of information, his exam is mostly on his lectures although they may be tricky, it can be easier if you listened carefully in his lectures (he tells you what is/isn't on the exam) I definitely recommend this professor :)

THIS PROF MAKES PYSCH INTERESTING! I love his teaching style...ppl had trouble with the midtrm though,ques/asw wer paragraphs but he said hed change that.DO NOT MISS A LECTURE WITH HIM, the ?s are all "what did your prof say about this/think about that" KNOW HIS LECTURES, he clearly tells you what u need to know, and what u can skip in the text..
He is a great prof. very straight forward. his exams r fair, as long as you study properly. ALSO he hints the materials that might be on exam and that is great help.
Amazing professor, he has an amazing attitude, a little egotistical, but still lots of fun, definitely recommend him

Oren really makes you want to question everything you learn. He also shows you how to apply these concepts to real life, probly because he's a clinical psychologist and has lots of experience outside the class. Lots of help before the exam, I took good notes, and got a solid A on the midterm.
love this prof, he's amazing!
Great prof, really knows his stuff, fair, funny, extremely helpful. I agree with the other comments, Oren's all about the critical thinking.

What I love most about Dr. Amitay is that some of the stuff he says seems pretty arrogant or just plain WTF?! And I kept good notes, and just like he promised at the start of the term, ALL the crazy s--t he said somehow ended up making sense and being confirmed somewhere down the road...EVERYTHING! He makes CRITICAL THINKING come alive this way....
Amazing, really really teaches a LOT and very helpful with online materials too.
Not bad... a bit overrated though.
He is the best

Dr. Amitay brings a freshness to UTSC that's been seriously lacking. (but some profs are good too!) He handles controbersial topics with a great balance of humor and seriosness and FORCES us to "think critically" about EVERYTHING, seriously EVERYTHING!! Fair (but pretty tough) test with CHOICES!
ok prof.  pretty easy to well.  i'd likely take this course again.

oren Amitay is amazing. He is one of the premier psych profs of North America, so if you get a chance to be in his section for one of the courses, consider yourself very lucky. He really knows the material he's talking about and his passion plus enthusiasm for teaching and psychology rubs off on the students. Very genuine prof.

Loved the class! Oren always keeps you alert and wondering what he's gonna say next! I also loved how he always kept us in the loop on intranet and he always responded so quickly to my emails. But don't ever miss class or you're doomed!!

Great professor, fair, entertaining, expert in his field, amazingly fast and detailed feedback, flexible, provocative, always available online, returns email immediately, I could go on and on...I'd suggest you take his course, but they all fill up so quickly!!

I just finished Prof Amitay's class today, and it was the 1st time I really enjoyed class at UTSC! Plus, I learned so much about psychology, research, and CRITICAL THINKING in the REAL WORLD (& academia) that I never learned before. He also used journal articles instead of a text and allowed US to choose a few of them, and gave very fast feedback!
Professor Amitay is fair... and his grading approach is ok.  Not a bad prof at all.
Amazing, prepared us very well, taught us so much beyond the text, was always there if we needed to speak to him, and was very accommodating to our needs.
He is great prof
